intro: Leptorkis elata, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky soils, preferring full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Leptorkis elata is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
